main event: On June 14, 1956, in Baltimore, Maryland, there was a ground-visual observation of a star-shaped object moving at high speed and then fading out of sight, witnessed by approximately 200 people over 2 hours and 6 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as star-shaped, white with a red tail, and moving at a very high speed before fading away.
Witnesses reported that the object was the width of a hand at arm's length, and it was observed at an approximate angle of elevation of 40-45 degrees.
Supplementary investigative efforts included checks with various aviation and meteorological authorities, but no definite explanation was reached.
One source described the object as remaining stationary in position, emitting a bluish haze or white blue exhaust trail, and then disappearing as if turning off a light.
The preparing officer concluded that the sighting was caused by an advertising aircraft, but the possibility of an unknown phenomenon remained.
sighted object: Star-shaped object with a white color and red tail
